title: Which is not a feature of OOP in general definitions?
Which was the first purely object oriented programming language developed?
Which feature of OOP indicates code reusability?
Which among the following, for a pure OOP language, is true?
answer_1: The language should follow at least 1 feature of OOP
answer_2: The language must follow only 3 features of OOP
answer_3: The language must follow all the rules of OOP
answer_4: The language should follow 3 or more features of OOP
right_answer: The language must follow all the rules of OOP

title: In which access should a constructor be defined, so that object of the class can be created in any function?
What happens when an object is passed by reference?
answer_1: Destructor is called at end of function
answer_2: Destructor is called when called explicitly
answer_4: Destructor is called when function is out of scope
